basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Jae Seong Lee. My vision is Full-Stack Blockchain Developer. As a business major, I looked at the future of IT technology while working and learning in various fields such as startups, non-profit organizations, and manufacturing. In the future society, I believe that the technology of trust will lead the future. So, I recently changed my career path as a blockchain developer and am focusing on development studies. Now I studying Javascript and Reactjs for Front-End. I upload and manage what I have studied on GitHub. Fork various open sources, analyze and study. I update series such as Go Lang basics on my IT blog. Also, I am posting a 'Development Diary Road to Developer' that I upload every day, which contains the progress of my growth as a developer. Thank you!

projects.title: GoBlock Project #1
projects.description: As the first project in the goBlock curriculum, it is a project that includes understanding and analysis of the consensus algorithm that is the basis of blockchain technology. Our team analyzes the basic blockchain trilemma and utilizes three technologies: Stella Consensus Protocol, Zero Knowledge-STARKs, and Ricardian Contract. We proposed a PoDC algorithm that modified the Stellar consensus algorithm, and proposed and announced a blockchain-based voting system using it.

projects.title: GoBlock Project #2
projects.description: This is the second project of the GoBlock training course, and it is a project that contains the process of understanding, installing, and running a demonstration of a private blockchain Hyperledger Fabric system. Our team proposed an Olympic scoring system with the goal of reclaiming the Olympic Games, a festival that can be trusted by people around the world by applying the technology of trust based on the idea from the judgment controversy at the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games. Visualize the judges' scorecard with Marbles, the property of the Hyperledger Fabric Marbles Demo. The goal was to implement a reliable scoring system by allowing a transaction to be generated and recorded on the ledger whenever a player is scored.

projects.title: GOPHER Hackhaton
projects.description: Participated in the 'Go Lang Hackathon Coding Contest based on SOLID Principles' held at CENTAP in Busan and won the grand prize. I wrote and presented the code at the competition.

projects.title: GitHub Ko Ext Project
projects.description: As a Contributor, I participated in the GitHub Korean translation project, one of the GitHub open source projects. It is a project that utilizes Typescript and CSS selector to translate GitHub pages into Korean. Anyone can use it conveniently by installing the Google Chrome extension, Github Korean.

projects.title: Go Gin Framework #1
projects.description: This is a project to create and distribute a bulletin board in the form of a guestbook using Gin, Go Lang's popular web framework.

toyproject.title: GOPHER Hackhaton / Hyperledger Fabric Demo Preview
mainTech: Grand Prize at Hackhaton, Special Prize at Demo Preview
